Reviews.Title: “Nice, Convienient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sa78258
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Europe and stayed 2 nights in Venice. I had stayed at this Hotel before and rewarded them by staying once again on this trip. The Hotel is located just to the left of the water Taxi for St. Mark's square. The room met all of my needs, was comfortable and most importantly, clean. The location was ideal as I had to only walk about 50 feet from the Water Taxi to the Hotel. The buffet breakfast was served in an annex about 100 meters from the Hotel. The Breakfast was surprisingly tasteful and was quite better than my last visit in 2008. The Hotel Staff are very accommodating in every regard. They could always be counted upon to direct me to the best places to dine or shop. I highly recommend this Hotel as it is very good for the Price and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DCShutterbug
Reviews.Content: Right on grand canal, seconds aways from St Mark's Square and easy boat bus stop. Easy to find right near huge horse statue. Room had a great view of the canal (no balcony), breakfast plentiful. Hotel let us store luggage after check out, also has a bathroom in lobby near breakfast room if you need one for free during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Gotta love the location!”
Reviews.Author: R T J
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right on the Riva, off the San Zaccaria vaporetto stop and a very short walk to St. Mark's Square. I stayed for 2 nights in the downstairs room of their annex bldg and thought both the room and bathroom was big and comfortable. However, the room is right next to the street so I was woken up from a good sleep several times a night by loud (and sometimes drunk and angry) passerbys. The breakfast had a good selection of everything but I especially loved the fresh ricotta cheese they served each day. The hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful. They weren't overly friendly but were patient in answering questions and providing information I requested. I would recommend this place to everyone and would most likely stay here again on a return trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great romantic hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: doscervezaporfavor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small, clean and quaint with personable staff and great service. Centrally located to everything you will want to see and do in Venice. 2 minute walk to San Marco square. 20 metres to the Grand Canal and water transportation. Buffet breakfast was great with lots of selection. Room was nicely decorated in typical Venetian style with upholstered walls and Murano glass fixtures. Bathroom was modern and well equipped. Great balcony with view of interior courtyards. Hall carpets need replacing and the contractors were there to measure them during our visit. Marco served as both desk clerk and concierge and did so extremely well. We were there for a week to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary and I would not hesitate recommending this hotel to anyone looking for a quaint romantic getaway in the heart of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, friendly and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Kat Cruz
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend in Venice with my daughter. Booked this hotel from the great reviews on tripadvisor and was not disappointed! We stayed in room 301, a double/twin attic room. On arrival the receptionist asked if we would like the beds separated as they'd made it up as a double (I hadn't specified in the booking a twin or double) so I was pleased with their hospitality. Room was beautiful and clean and the view was amazing. It was nice chilling on the roof top terrace watching the world go by. Really easy to get to, San Zaccaria vaporetto stop, 3 mins walk to San Marco piazza. Many places to eat nearby. If you're travelling on a budget, we bought a 3 day Actv plus return airport transfer bus online (3 days unlimited travel on vaporettos and return on the airport bus no 5. If you book at least a week in advance, you pay less). Breakfast, like everyone else has said, is in another building round the corner. It's basic but filling, eggs are hard boiled but there are bread rolls, croissants, soft and hard cheeses, 2 cold meats, yogurts, jams, cereal etc and fresh tea/coffee is brought to your table. Some people have complained about the noise. Yes, the bells from San Zacharia are loud but enchanting. We were on the top floor so any noise we heard was from guests going up to the terrace, the door was next to ours. Coming from London, I actually found it quiet and at night, I actually opened the Lagoon facing window to hear the water and life! I would definitely stay here again. Yes, it is rated as 3 star but for the location, helpful and friendly staff, clean rooms, it could be 4 star compared to others we've stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Attic Room with Lagoon View!”
Reviews.Author: garylim007
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the best throughout our 2 week's honeymoon in Europe. I chose it because of its convenient location. It definitely offered more than that. On the night of our arrival at the Hotel Paganelli, we were pleasantly surprised by the staff at the front desk. He was very friendly, helpful and spoke good English. On top of that, we were delighted when he offered us a free upgrade to the attic room with a view of the lagoon! The room was big for Europe, comfy bed, bathroom clean and well appointed. It was quiet at night, so we slept really well. The best part was to wake up every morning to the most scenic view of Venezia! This is priceless...and was what i always wanted for my honeymoon. There is a roof top terrace for guests to hang out. I enjoyed relaxing there with a beer and some snacks. It was chilly during winter though. But we could watch boats and gondolas gliding pass us on the Grand Canal. It was awesome. The breakfast at the annex was very good. We had a hearty Italian breakfast every morning. Coffee was great, nice croissants, lots of jam, cheese, nutella, fruits and yogurt. More than enough to start the day. We had a wonderful time in Venice and being there during winter makes it even more special. There was no crowd, we could experience the mystical Venice alleys at night plus all the glorious Italian cuisines...everything was just lovely. Recalling my memories at Venice Paganelli makes me smile:)

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: chaucer1114
Reviews.Content: Good reception, room and breakfast service! Good coffee! But have to walk to another building to eat. Clean and large room! Bathroom with bathtub and shower! We can choose whatever we want. Wireless internet is very convient in the room. Very near the boat bus stop! Walk to supermarket less than 15 min. Very near San Marco! The price is not high! This is a Chinese restaurant around the corner. And the food is very delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great view”
Reviews.Author: bclements
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice on December 23 for 3 nights at the Paganelli with our 2 teenaged granddaughters. We were dropped by our water taxi in front of the hotel. Our rooms were on the 2nd floor with the view of the Grand Canal pictured on the website. The bathrooms were well appointed with modern fixtures; the rooms were roomy for Europe and the beds were very comfortable. We had no noise problems from adjoining rooms nor from the street level. Each morning's breakfast in the annex (very few steps to get there) was plentiful; the staff was attentive and the coffee & cappucino were quickly delivered. The only negative was the carpet in the common areas of the main hotel (did not see the hotel portion of the annex) needed to be replaced or at least thoroughly cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: malvernian
Reviews.Content: If location is your main criterion, you cannot go wrong with this hotel. It really is very close to St Mark's Square, yet it doesn't cost a fortune. Don't expect five star luxury or services, but you will receive a friendly welcome and good service from the front desk. Our room was on the top floor of the main hotel (the one that opens up onto the Riva degli Schiavoni). It was the smallest of all the rooms on that floor, and its balcony faced onto the hotel courtyard rather than the Riva, but that was all I expected. I had booked the hotel on a tight budget, and received a very good deal for the room. Despite being the smallest room, it was certainly big enough for the two of us. The bed was comfortable (could have done with another pillow though). The bathroom had no bath - but the shower cubicle was spacious and the water was hot. As usual with Italian hotels, there was a bidet in the bathroom; I've never yet used one, so can't comment on its effectiveness :-) We had a built-in wardrobe in our room, but no other storage at all. Not to worry, we were able to hang our clothes up to de-crease - and the rest of the clothes we left in our main suitcase, perched on the supplied suitcase stand. Perfetto! The room came with a safe for our valuables. The room also had a balcony, which would have been lovely in the summer - for sitting out and sipping some wine, I guess. But this was January, and very cold, so the balcony was pretty pointless. Breakfast was taken in a different building, just around the corner. It was adequate, and quite tasty. Bread and croissants were always fresh, the cold meats were okay (salami and ham), and there were cereals and cold hard-boiled eggs available too. Coffee or tea was offered on entry - and they didn't skimp on quantity in that respect. If you have ever stayed in a hotel in Germany or Holland, you will recognise the style of the breakfast. Personally, I would have liked some hot food, but as it turned out, it wasn't required. My only gripe was the presence of what I can only assume was a night-light high up on one of the walls. It was permanently on, giving out a bright green light through the night. I could find no way to turn it off, so I stuck a plaster over it, to reduce the glare. Please be aware, I am unusual in that I need a pitch black room to sleep in - probably because I have always lived in the country where pitch black nights are the norm - and I may be over-sensitive to such night-lights. But my first night in the hotel was very difficult for me until I found the sticking plaster solution. I would heartily recommend this hotel to anybody, whether on a budget or not. If my finances permit it and I have an opportunity to stay in venice once more, I shall insist on using this hotel once again.

Reviews.Title: “Positives and Negatives...”
Reviews.Author: serving4theking_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right on the main waterway, making it incredibly convenient. It was quiet and the breakfast was very decent. Only 5 minute walk to St. Mark square and only 12-15 minute easy walk through shopping/eating areas to Rialto bridge. Unfortunately, the hotel didn't meet our expectations. Last year we stayed at Best Western Hotel Ala near Paganelli (on the other side of St. Mark's Square), and we should have done that again. My parents stayed in the room next to us, and had several issues with their room - not being able to get the internet signal, problems with the heater (their room was much colder than ours), a moderate leak in the bathroom sink... of the several issues, the only issue the hotel helped with was the leak in the bathroom which never got fully fixed. For the rest of the issues, the hotel reply was a nice, but not very helpful, apology. Our room, even in January, had a mosquito problem (with windows closed the whole time, so they must be hibernating inside the room somewhere). My parents' room did not have a mosquito problem. I'm not saying you shouldn't stay here, but the location and convenience should be balanced with the negatives as well. I would want to rate it 2.5, but I gave it a 3.

Reviews.Title: “Will come back again...”
Reviews.Author: douglum
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed there for 3 nights in mid Dec 2011. Small but charming hotel, backed by great location and very good service from one of the Front Desk Manager, Marco. Very patient with our many questions. His recommendation of 2 restaurants were spot on, good and affordable. He even suggested where we could buy the Venetian Masks. We stayed in 1 family room which was nice size but some of the beds can be more comfortable. Be sure to ask for a room facing the water front. If some hot stuff can be added to the breakfast spread, it would be perfecto.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: way2go
Reviews.Content: Our lagoon view room had a gorgeous view. The best part was that it accomodated our family of five which is very hard to find in Europe. The room was a little outdated, and the carpeting in the hallways were stained but the location was great and the front desk help was very helpful. Would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall location, but beware room 125”
Reviews.Author: bmoore212
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here in December 2011. Location of the hotel is fantastic- right across from the vaporetto stop, so none of the bag-lugging you see so many tourists coping with in Venice. The lobby of the main building is very nice, and check-in was very smooth. I stayed in a single room in the annex- a building right around the corner (where breakfast is served). My room- #125- was located on the street-level. Whoever decided that having a hotel room's exterior wall be all windows wasn't thinking. There was tons of noise from the people walking by all night, and a call-box kept going off. I knew almost immediately upon getting into my room that I would have asked for another room if I was staying more than 1 night. The room itself was very adequate, and the bathroom was spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful value in a brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: AmataH
Reviews.Content: Located just around the corner for Piazza San Marco, in front of the San Zaccaria vaporetto stop (making travel from the train station absolutely seamless), Hotel Paganelli is a real Venetian find. Courteous, helpful, English-speaking reception staff provided a warm welcome and I soon found my room to be surprisingly spacious for the price, as well as spotlessly clean. Good linens and towels, excellent heating (including a heated towel rail in the bathroom), excellent, free wi-fi and very tasty continental breakfast (also included in my tariff) of cereals, yoghurts, meats, cheeses, breads and pastries, as well as coffee made to order by a delightfully cheerful lady, made Paganelli an outstanding choice on a tight budget. My room was located on the ground floor of the hotel's annexe, which is just down a side street, facing the lovely San Zaccaria church. I think this was the only ground floor room, and its proximity to the street was the sole down side of my stay. Even though there is relatively little passing foot traffic, it was very, VERY noisy - every step and every word of every conversation was clearly audible, even with windows and curtains closed. In warmer weather, with windows open, it would be even worse. I would happily stay at the Paganelli again, but I would avoid Room 125 like the plague for this reason. I expect rooms on other floors are a good deal quieter and more private. Overall: I was stunned by how cheap the room rate was, and terribly impressed by the hotel and its staff as a whole. It's a great choice for the budget traveller who also wants the luxury of a location so near San Marco - but I would avoid Room 125 and ask specifically for a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, cute room”
Reviews.Author: megan2391
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend in February 2011. We had an extremely enjoyable stay at the Hotel Paganelli. We were located in the second building around the corner from the main, but that didnâ€™t bother us, we had a beautiful Venetian view from our window. The room was cute and decorated in a traditional Venetian style. The bathroom was pretty tiny but did everything it needed to. The best thing about our stay was the location! Located perfect for the water taxi from the airport and also finding your way back after getting lost in the mess of walkways. Will always stay here when in Venice in the future

Reviews.Title: “my opinion...stay here”
Reviews.Author: klik_gal
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the annex building a few steps away from the main building. The room did not have a glorious view and was surely not something spectacular, but was cosy, had a retro feel, warm, clean and very good for individual stay and moreover I only needed the room to sleep and I was getting value for money. The sound of the bells reverberated through the alleys and into the room, still living the experience after a week. The best part though is the location. You get off the boat at San Zaccaria and there is the hotel. It is a couple of minutes walk to San Marco and the Bridge of Sighs can be seen in every mood. Do not have to walk far to catch a glorious sunrise over the Gondolas. The staff are very helpful and very knowledgeable, especially Marco, told me the best places for food and to visit and I was visiting during Christmas when most shops closed. The buffet breakfast had loads of variety and kept me full till lunch even with all the walking. Ask for a map as soon as you check-in if you haven't got one already.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: cbarilla
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife have stayed at hotel Paganelli two times over the last two years and i must say that of all places we have stayed in venice Paganalli was the best. For newbees going to venice you get right on the water taxi at the train staion and you get dropped off right in front of the hotel. Other hotels more inland will have you walking around for a while if you dont know the lay of the land. Rooms are perfect size and very very clean. Stay in the main hotel and you will not be sorry. If you have a the means $$ reserve the lagoon view as it is the best, They have a roof top terrace that we ate cheese bread and drank wine while watching the boats and people go by and that will last in our hearts forever! A++++++ service. WE will be back ASAP!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: tabby182
Reviews.Content: Located 5 minutes away (or less) from San Marco, Doge's Palace and the Bridge of Sighs. Vaporetto stop was right at the hotel's doorstep (San Zaccaria). Our double room was at the main building on the group floor - the room was cosy and clean but I found it to be rather small. Also, although there was free WIFI, we couldn't access it from our room. (Could only access it if we stood by our room door and/or we opened our door)

Reviews.Title: “Cozy but small”
Reviews.Author: jsjj88
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to the end of the grand canal, which takes about half an hour to reach by the water bus. Those who have to rush for the train out of Venice should take note of that. Room is quaint, cozy, but very small. It is relatively cheap compared to other accommodations in Venice, so what you pay is what you get. But for a simple night's stay, it's more than decent.

Reviews.Title: “Location - need we say more”
Reviews.Author: Wienprater
Reviews.Content: When a friend recommended this hotel, we did not hesitate to book after we heard about its fantastic location. A few steps from the hotel is the Bridge of Sighs. A few more steps, San Marco is just around the corner. Also, the Vaporetto stop is almost in front of the hotel. What better place to stay? We had booked a double room in the main building & were given a free upgrade to a triple room. Nice, spacious and clean room & bathroom. Friendly staff. Breakfast was served in the annex building next door. If you're coming from the main train station, take Vaporetto #1 which goes along the Grand Canal (abt45min, 6.50euro). Stop at San Zaccaria. Cross the bridge (with ramps) to the right. The hotel is just behind the Equestrian statue. Look out for the yellow building. We will definitely stay at this hotel again when we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “November 2011, 2 night stay for a group of women”
Reviews.Author: NicaTravels53022
Reviews.Content: We booked 6 rooms at the Paganelli and it's annex building a week ago and found the hotel to be very conveniently located and the staff very helpful. They even made us a take out breakfast for the morning we had to leave really early. Their website's photos are accurate. The rooms small but fine with modern bathrooms. I'd stay there again as it is really easy to get water taxis, vaporettos and walk to everthing from there.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel - tiny room”
Reviews.Author: paulmacca
Reviews.Content: Very handily placed 200m from St Marc's square. Staff were mostly friendly - room was very attractive but tiny. Bathroom very cramped No hot water one morning. Breakfast rather bland

Reviews.Title: “A nice romantic place in the heart of Venice.”
Reviews.Author: distance10
Reviews.Content: The greatest advantage of this hotel is its place. It s directly in front of the Vaporetto Stationâ€� San MACO-S. Zaccariaâ€� which provides a nice connection to the whole Venice and the nearby islands. The most fabulous monuments of Venice (San Marco and Ponte dei Sospiri) are reachable within of a couple of minutes of walk. By the area nearby there are a lot of Cafes, Restaurants and Shops (ask the front desk for suggestions) and also the police department of Venice, which makes it feel safe. The staff is very friendly and speaks good English, while the rooms are always clean and well designed. I would recommend this hotel, to anyone, who would like to reach almost everything in Venice on feet, to live in a hotel of a very good quality (for the Venice standards) and combine his vacation with a nice breakfast and Lan-internet free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Lyn27524
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at Hotel Paganelli in September and were thrilled to find a quiet room at the back of the hotel with a little terrace overlooking rooftops! Massimo welcomed us at Reception and kindly stored our bags until our room was ready; he was most helpful with advice and assistance. The room was very comfortable and it was so good to have a comfortable bed and quiet room for a good night's sleep. This is something not always possible in a busy city! It is lovely to have a drink at day's end sitting at the little table in front of the hotel on the quayside, or in the centre courtyard behind the reception. It is an ideal location to see the majority of sites and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “small room - great location”
Reviews.Author: UCBL
Reviews.Content: We have been for a two day romantic gataway in venice. The location of the hotel is perfect and it has a nice looking fassade. There is a Vaporetto station more or less in front of it and the Piazza San Marco is literally around the corner. Check in was quick and efficient, only the employee at the reception was very economical of words which did not feel like a warm welcome. Our room was located in a separate building right next door. That means no view, but not that much noise as well. The room itself was with approxemately 11 mÂ² including bath the tiniest double (??) room in this rate level I have ever stayed in. The interior was venecian style with a french bed, bed side table, chair, small secretary and a built in waredrobe. In the bathroom we had shower, basin, bidet and toilet. There was a new flat screen tv and a little safety box. The pillows were hard like bricks and had nearly the same size. We only had hand luggage and it was hard to move in the room. But most importand the room was clean, well kept and even had apart from the size a cosy flair. The breakfast is not worth to go for. I would name it economic continental. There are many nice coffee bars around with a proper breakfast for resonable prices. The conclusion is, try to get a room in the main building and be carefull with cheap deals via wholesaler homepages...this may have an effect on the room size and quality. The location can not be better but the service and the breakfast can. Dear hotellier get some motivated and service orientated employees or maybe just pay the one's you have better...with those room rates there should be a propper share for the staff. Knowing the facts we might have to expect, we would probably come back.

Reviews.Title: “Still very very good. A hidden gem.”
Reviews.Author: Dungan
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Paganelli six times over the years - always in the first floor Lagoon View room with two windows. Since our last visit the venerable Paganelli cousins who operated the hotel for so long have both died. May they resting peace. But staff told me that the hotel is still in the Paganelli family. It has recently been totally remodled including the installation of a lift! Still a wonderful place to stay IF you can score one of the few Lagoon View rooms. Same San Giorgio Maggiore view as the Danieli two doors away at a fraction of the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Melva M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located making it very easy to get around walking or via the "boats". Our only concern was the service provided by the front desk help. While they were usually responsive and helpful providing requested information, we felt the help was often overwhelmed with the demands of administrative work on the computer. It appeared a little additional help would make a big difference in their ability to provide the service they would like to provide. We would recommend this hotel with some reservation.....the hall carpets need to be replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Central, convenient and close to transport, a hotel for everyone.”
Reviews.Author: fredbloggs110
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a hotel in the very heart of Venice, only a stones throw away from San Marco and with an airport waterbus stop just outside, then look no further. The Hotel Paganelli is only 3 star but the rooms are all well appointed and clean and those at the front of the hotel look across the canal directly onto the Isola di San Giorgio on the other side. If you have sometime idle away then there's an excellent roof top terrace where you can watch the boats travelling up and down the Canale Della Giudecca and into the Canal Grande. The Piazza San Marco with all its attractions are only a few minutes and 2 bridges away so what more could you ask. The hotel staff are all very frendly and the front desk speaks English. Prices in Venice are never cheap but the location combined with the ease of getting to and from the airport make this an ideal place to stay. Internet available in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff - a pleasure in a heavily touristed city”
Reviews.Author: Noducktoday
Reviews.Content: We decided on a last minute visit to Venice during a stay outside of Verona. Being early September, I thought our chances of finding two rooms at a clean and affordable hotel would be difficult but we found it at Paganelli. AS you'll read in other reviews, it's located right near San Mark's piazza, almost next door to the Doge's palace. As soon as we set foot in the hotel, we were happy. Massimo at the front desk suggested an excellent restaurant nearby frequented mainly by locals. We also very happy to find that both our rooms had been upgraded. Our room was excellent. It was spacious, it was clean. We had wifi and a safe in our room. The bed was really comfortable and the shower great. We couldn't have asked for more from a 3 star hotel in such a heavily touristed city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel...would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: JoJoJVanders
Reviews.Content: In a superb area in Venice! The hotel is conveniently located to Piazza San Marco...where it's all at. Also located nearby is the vaporetto. As a solo traveler, the room was small but clean, comfortable. The internet worked, as did the air. If I had to complain about anything it would be that I was close to the door and could hear people coming up and down the stairwell. There are two Hotel Paganelli sections. One by reception near the water with the stunning views. These are for the suites. And, the other location is located in the adjacent alley, where everyone has breakfast. There is no lift for this section of the hotel. Maximus at reception was very helpful. Breakfast was satisfactory. Have fun! Chrs, JoJo

Reviews.Title: “Accomodating and romantic”
Reviews.Author: phdgracie
Reviews.Content: Very clean and nice, room is in old building but well renovated. Our room had a nice private balcany! Right by the bank of the lagoon and water bus station, very convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent rooms and location!”
Reviews.Author: rlsrlj
Reviews.Content: Careful-you can fall in love with this place! The rooms are great, the staff is nice. Breakfast was excellent and the location is superb! What more would you want?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel right next to St Mark's Square”
Reviews.Author: NGriff11
Reviews.Content: On the water front right next to the S. Zaccaria vaporetto stop this hotel is all you could ask for. Two miniutes walk from St Mark's Square this hotel has fabulous staff who will assist you in any way. The only negative of the whole experience is the breakfast. Be sure to ask to go up to the terrace to have a drink, a magnificant view. The rooms are not huge but they are clean and quiet. Be sure to stay in the main house as we can't comment on the annex.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate hotel in an intimate city”
Reviews.Author: Carol_Siriusb
Reviews.Content: The Paganelli is a small, elegant and intimate hotel in an elegant and intimate city. Situated on the Grand Canal (Riva degli Schiavoni) between Piazza San Marco and the big hotels like the Hotel Daniele, it has a small lobby but the renovated building now has a lift. The hotel staff at reception and at breakfast are all very cordial and helpful. Our favorite room has a small balcony that overlooks the Gondoliere stop at Santa Zacharia. This is the entry to the magnificent Piazza San Marco. Even though this room was not available, our room was at the top of the hotel... beamed ceilings included. The furnishings are elegant, silk walls and Murano blown-glass light fixtures. Our room did include a great window that opened out onto the Gondoliere station, the Grand Canal and the Basilicas of Venezia. Fabulous. And as in so many nice Italian hotels, a well-appointed bathroom. We discovered the roof-top terrazzo on our second day and enjoyed the sunset with cameras, a great Barolo wine and Venetian sweets. Our private roof-top deck with ancient, breathtaking views and sounds. Forget mosquitoes for a while. But keep windows closed at night or there will be blood on the tracks... The breakfast served at the Annex building around the corner is a wonderful version of Italian hospitality at the beginning of your day. Cereals, fruits in various forms, yogurts and jams, breads, sweet cakes, croissants and other patisserie, juices and very good espresso and lattes. Included in the price - as is excellent Wi-Fi - even on the the rooftop deck. We highly recommend this hotel and itâ€™s staff! Leave time in your trip for a dinner at Osteria Bancogiro, near the market, oltre Ponte Rialto.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: redpainter
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel for the location and it was truely perfect. If is a step off the water taxi station and 5 minutes from San Marco square. If you get lost in the Venice you can easily locate the tower in the square and find your way back to the hotel. I found the staff very helpful and willing to provide recommendations for restaurants and places to visit. The room was a bit small but functional, if you have a ton of luggage that may be an issue. I stayed in the annex which I found to be perfect and very peaceful away from the busy water ways. I would go back again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alex1426
Reviews.Content: The Paganelli hotel is a wonderful hotel excellently located next to the Piazza S. Marco and the S. Zaccaria vaporetto stop. Great staff at the reception desk. I stayed at the annex, where they serve breakfast. My room was at the ground floor but nevertheless was very quiet, since it's located on a side street. Don't miss this "jewel" if you plan to travel to this amazing city!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: davidkwchong
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as I read a lot of accounts of people getting lost in Venice and not being able to find their hotels with heavy luggage in tow etc. Take the water vaporetto no.1 and get of at San Zaccharia stop, the hotel is just towards your right. . It was also a few minutes' walk from where we were supposed to meet our tour guide and the pier for our trip to Murano, Burano and Torcello islands. We had an early train to catch when we left Venice. We took vaporetto no.52 which departed right in front of the hotel. So location-wise, it was perfect. We paid more for a room in the main building and were rewarded with a fantastic view from Room 301, a quaint little room on the highest floor. Paolo at reception was very friendly and helpful, offering to carry our luggage up the last flight of stairs to reach our room. My only complaint was that only wired internet access was available in our room, which was useless for my iPhone and my netbook which had no Ethernet port. Wireless access was available downstairs in the courtyard. Breakfast was in a separate building. Typical standard fare, but they were kind enough to let us in early the morning we departed Venice to enable us to catch our train. All in all, a satisfactory stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, close to St Mark's Square and the San Zaccaria boat stop.”
Reviews.Author: jmv1978
Reviews.Content: In January the rates are extremely reasonable for two travellers in a room looking out over the San Marco basin. The hotel staff are so helpful and the breakfast service is formidable. We stayed 5 nights in Venice for $ 600. Cdn. Divided between two people, very reasonable for the location and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: bra_77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close from Piazza San Marco (less than 5 minutes walking). Very easy to reach (located in front of "vaporetto" stop), comfy, clean, with helpful staff. I got a promotion on internet, and stayed in the annexe. There is nothing to complain. We don't have the same beautiful view that the others rooms have, but even though, still good sized room, with access to same amenities. The benefits of price and location are the best! Definitely I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Ashby de la Zouch, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: henniky
Reviews.Content: I had arranged this 5 day visit to Venice as a birthday surprise for my partner who had zero knowledge of the trip until we arrived at the airport on the morning of travel. I had exchanged emails with the Hotel before our arrival and received quick and helpful replies. The location was perfect and being so close to the San Zaccaria water bus stop made the arrival easy and we didn't need to drag our luggage around this beautiful city. Check-in was fine and Marco on the desk was helpful when he took us to our room in the nearby annexe. The room was as we had expected. Comfortable and spacious and what we had paid for. We enjoyed our evening but noted on our return to the room what appeared to be an ant in the bed. No big deal when all said and done. We awoke in the morning to find what appeared to be traces of other unwelcome guests. We had our breakfast, returned to the room and confirmed we certainly had unwelcome visitors. We advised reception and Marco advised he would investigate and we'd see him later. At mid-day Marco tried to call us (our mobiles were off) rang home to the UK and emailed all to no avail. We got back to the hotel at 16.00 and he confirmed we were correct and that our cases had been packed and a new room at another hotel had been found at no extra cost to us. No charge was to be made for our stay the previous night. The clothes we had unpacked were not in our cases and I had to return to the room to collect from the chest of drawers. The bed linen had been sealed in refuse sacks, the room door was sealed with tape. Clearly the hotel was taking the matter seriously. We moved to our new hotel 400m away and continued to enjoy our visit. Now home and writing this review, my skin is covered in a severe rash. An allergic reaction to the uninvited guests feasting on me and a sad end to what should have been a great trip. Marco did all he could in the circumstances which we appreciated. However, hotels of any quality do need to ensure this sort of situation does not arise and housekeeping staff must be vigilant at all times. Would we return? Yes we would. Would we recommend to others? Maybe but we'd suggest they inspect the room before taking occupancy. Overall opinion? Of Marco, good when he realised we were not looking for a freebie as I guess some guests do. Of the hotel as a whole? What we expected. Make of this what you will..

Reviews.Title: “Great location but just decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYCnative76
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a really convenient location, right by St. Mark's Square. I stayed at the annex around the block from the main hotel. My room was really small and super antiquated. The decor was so out of date and the furniture looked like it was from the 60's. The bathroom was tiny and had the worst shower that would flood the place after you took it. It was clean, which was a plus. I didn't like having to leave my key with reception in the other building every time I went out. Breakfast was pretty bad but standard for Italy I guess. Basically bread with cold cuts. On a plus side, I got free wi-fi in my room. I think the place is a bit pricey for the quality but I guess you pay for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: kneably
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Hotel Paganelli and were very happy with everything. Our room was a good size and very comfortable and clean, with a window which looked out over the Lagoon. Even though the waterfront was always busy, we were never bothered by noise at night. Breakfast is served in the hotel annexe just next door, and was fine but basic. All the staff were pleasant and helpful in giving us directions to various sights, and the vaporetto stop is really close, less than 2 minutes from the hotel, it's very convenient. A great place to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: traveller209939
Reviews.Content: We were returning to Venice at the end of a cruise and required a hotel for a nights stay-over. We chose the Hotel Paganelli through the Tripadvisor web site, and this proved to be a very good choice. The location is excellent, right opposite the San Zacaria water-bus station, and about 5 minutes walk to St Marks square. The hotel itself is quite unpretentious. On arrival the reception staff were exceedingly helpful, allowing us early entry to our room. The room and bathroom was amply large enough for two people for a night stop. both were spotlessly clean. The breakfast was taken at the annex hotel one minute walk in the next lane. The breakfast was the usual Continental breakfast, simple but ample, and the Latte coffee was a dream

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: campingcj
Reviews.Content: This was a great property - wonderful location, lovely staff, and well priced. We would stay again and recommend for friends. The roof top balcony is a treat too. Very easy to find and a central spot to explore Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, small rooms, good location, don't pay for upgrade”
Reviews.Author: TexanFansFromKaty
Reviews.Content: This is a former convent. We stayed in one of the cells which was tiny but had thick walls that were conducive to sleeping. Location is just around corner from San Zaccaria and a short walk from St. Mark's (less than 5 minutes), which is really a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “A view at a cost, but don't bother at Redentore”
Reviews.Author: KPPinnage
Reviews.Content: We had a week trip to Venice and the Veneto, started here for 3 nights and then ended back here for the Redentore festival. The hotel does have a fantastic position overlooking the Grand Canal and it rather plays on this fact. We chose a room with a view, and the view was incredible, but we really did pay for it, lagoon view costs extra and most of the rooms don't have it. Our room was well appointed but for a superior deluxe was small - just enough room to walk past the end of the bed. A colleague of mine who stayed here also had a superior deluxe room which was much larger (enough to fit an additional open double sofa bed so as to accommodate 4 people so I fear we may have been diddled there). It is always worth mentioning that it was clean, no bad smells, fresh linen etc and all amenities in the room that we tried worked fine. The air con worked but it was badly placed - above our heads in bed so we would get very cold, it wasn't the quietest most modern machine either. There is no restaurant and breakfast is served in a nearby hotel under the same ownership. The breakfast food is nice enough but not so good that you'd fear oversleeping and missing it. There is a roof terrace which offers the same great views and for most guests their only look at the view. We wanted to go up at night and managed to get the key of the night manager to do so, breaking the house rules I think. We were assessed I guess and deemed to not be a likely disturbance. Being up there late at night was really nice, but there is only room of one table to have a clear view, the rest would look at the first table. I would advise buying some Prosecco from a supermarket (inland from the grand canal for a major reduction in cost) earlier in the day and putting it in your room fridge and then go up and enjoy the night view like we did. The service good if a little formal, the chap behind the desk was very kind to us, carefully looking after our expensive hand painted Venetian marks while we were out exploring the Veneto between our two stays. He was also very helpful and informative regarding any question we fired at him, including airport transfers. The hotel is in a good location very close to St Marks but after seeing the price and reading all the good reviews I was underwhelmed. It felt that the management were milking their location for all it is worth. The night of the Redentore festival we were invited to attend a cocktail party on the terrace for a 30euro charge pp, we accepted. This was really quite disappointing, the terrace is normally free to be on and the one time that it would be used to its full effect they charged us 60 Euro extra for the privilege of a few glasses of Prosecco. Total profiteering. While I was looking out at the fireworks and all the boats bobbing in the lagoon I could only think that I wanted to be in one of those boats... The fireworks were so good you would have been able to see them almost anywhere in the city and you don't need to be on this terrace. In summary if you want a lagoon view then this hotel could be what you are after, if however you would be content with a quiet inner canal view or no view at all (after all this is a city to be explored not stuck in a hotel room) then I think you would find better rooms and services for less cash.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, small but tidy room, below average breakfast”
Reviews.Author: marknmeils
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and were very happy with the Hotel Paganelli. The position, as others have commented on, is clearly a winner being right on the doorstep of the ferry stops and close to St Mark's Square, Doges Palace etc. We arrived late (about 11pm, as our easyJet flight was delayed (as usual!!)) and were thankful that the hotel reception was open 24 hours. Perhaps fortunately, our room was in the part of the hotel that faces onto the canal as this appears to have been given a fairly recent makeover. As a result, although small, our room was quite modern and fresh, and the exposed wooden beams in the ceiling a nice touch. The room also opened out to a small courtyard so we could stretch our legs and get a bit of air if required. The only downside was the included breakfast (which is served at the other part of the hotel around the corner and up a side street) that was average at best ... on our first morning (a Sunday), the bread rolls were as hard as rocks and were at least a day old if not more, and the rest (cereal, cold meats, cheese, yoghurt etc) was not inspiring or tasty. We ate at nearby cafes the next two days. The front desk staff (of which we met 3 on different shifts) were helpful without being overly friendly, but spoke good english. Overall, a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Updated, Clean and Affordable Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: shortiiee21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to do a Mediterranean Cruise for our honeymoon. The cruise embarked from Venice so we decided to spend a couple days in Venice beforehand. When researching for hotels, we found that there were plenty to choose from. We wanted a place that was affordable and in a convenient location. My sister, who had been to Venice with her husband before, recommended Hotel Paganelli. After checking out their website, we decided to book Hotel Paganelli because it was in our price range, the rooms looked clean and nice, and because of the location of the hotel. The hotel was only a short walk from St. Mark's and right in front of a water bus stop (which comes in handy when you arrive and leave from the airport). We got in around 5pm and the front desk guy immediately knew who we were since we were the last people checking in. He took us to our room and explained everything from how to operate the lights, leaving your key when you leave, and getting breakfast in the morning. Our room was right off the courtyard in the main building. Overall, the room was small, but was clean and had modern furnishings. It had a flat screen tv and a safe for us to store our valuables in when we left the room. Throughout our stay, the staff was very friendly and helpful. One of them even called in a dinner reservation for us because we didn't know if they spoke english or not. The only bad experience we had was one night when my husband and I came back late from a night out to find that the front door was lock and all the lights in the lobby were out. A guy next door assured us that there is supposed to be someone on duty 24 hours a day. After a few minutes of knocking on the glass, the front desk guy gets up from the couch he had been sleeping on and opens the door for us. For a minute there, my husband and I thought we were going to have to sleep on a bench in St. Mark's square! I though the breakfast was perfectly fine, but that's probably because I don't really eat a lot for breakfast in general. All I need is a good cup of coffee (which there was plenty of) and some fruit or pastries. I'd rather save the calories for a delicious Venetian lunch or dinner. I would definitely choose Hotel Paganelli if I ever visit Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: italiangirl28
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location! St. Mark's square is just a quick walk away. The hotel is very clean and the room is ample in size. The hotel staff is kind and willing to help. I would definitely stay here again on my next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible staff attitude, great location”
Reviews.Author: onlythemostawesome
Reviews.Content: After having stayed at Hilton Molino Stucky for two nights, we had the misfortune of spending our last night in Venice at this hotel. Before paying advance deposit, we we were shown a room "exactly the same"as the one we were to be given. It wasn't a great room, but it appeared recently refurbished, clean and good-sized so we decided to take it. However, when we came back at night with our luggage, we were shocked that we were given an old room, half the size of the one shown to us. We immediately told the staff at the front desk who was very rude and dismissive. He even said if we didn't like the room we could leave (money, of course,will not be returned) and if they were to find any takers for the room they would email us to return the money!!! At 7pm on a Sunday evening in Venice they of course knew we weren't going anywhere. After a gruelling and extremely frustrating hour, we had no option but to take that room. There were other better rooms available, by their own admission, but they just refused to let us take them unless we paid extra for them. The only saving grace was that we were leaving the next morning at 6! The one and only good thing about this hotel is it's location and that is what they seem to be so arrogant about. It was a nasty end to a beautiful vacation in Venice. We wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money on the Grand Canal!”
Reviews.Author: ViraatRaj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paganelli in Venice from the 19-22nd of July. Booked it thru www.clickitbookit.travel @ Euro 127 per night including breakfast and taxes. Location: Unbelievable! On the Grand Canal. Next to the Londra Palace. Water Taxis dock right in front of the hotel! 2 minutes to San Marco's square and the Doges Palace as well as the theaters and shopping areas. Service: The reception blokes were quite quick and efficient. Breakfast is at Paganelli part II. Only superior and deluxe rooms are at this location- on the Grand Canal. Standard rooms are in another building- about 45 seconds away in the first alley - not on the Grand Canal. This is where breakfast is served. Breakfast is ok. Rooms: Since ours was a superior room, we were on the Grand Canal location. Rooms are not very large but they are very well appointed. The air conditioning was good. We were in room number 211 which even has a small sit out area. No view of the Grand Canal though. This is a small hotel and therefore only some rooms overlook the Grand Canal. This is a great hotel for your stay in Venice. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Toto2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple, all in early 60's stayed at this hotel one night prior to a Greek Island Cruise. We were looking for a great location and found it. Just a few feet from the Vaporatto stop at San Marco. Rooms had recently been refurbished and were very clean and modern. We didn't have much view but some rooms view the canal. There was a cute roof top garden that opened the day we were there. Nice new furniture. The four of us took a bottle of wine and watched the boat traffic on the canal. It is not an inexpensive hotel but if convenience is a priority, then this hotel is the one.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel- bad staff”
Reviews.Author: tres-passerr
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel is perfect- a stone's throw from the nearest water taxi point and San Marco's sqaure. The Hotel room is tiny - in line with most Venice Hotels i assume, but the rooms are neat and nicely done. The Continental breakfast is ok- nothing to write home about. The staff, sadly, leaves a lot to be desired. My wife and I checked-in in the aft'noon, eagerly looking forward to Venice as we have heard so many wonderful things about this beautiful city. The front office manager was not the most friendly chap- no smiles and no conversations. Anyway, we discovered that night that the Hotel had no air-conditioning and called the front office to check. The room gets pretty stuffy (even with the windows open); and to make matters worse, there's a clock tower very close by- so expect to hear the chimes till you can keep you eyes open. We were told that the Govt of Venice does not allow air-conditioning in May (??) and we shd check with the Manager next morning. We were a little surprised to hear something like this, but it was pretty late in the night so we just decided to talk to the manager the next day. We decided to google air-con rules in Venice the next eve and were shocked to find out that there are no 'Govt rules' regarding the same. We were disappointed that we were lied to about something like this rather than finding a solution to the problem. We called the Frnt Office again and asked them if they can provide a fan. They had no fans. They then said the air-con is centrally controlled and apparently, some people wanted to turn the heating on,(which again we doubted) so they had to keep the air-con shut. The guy at the Frnt office during the night shift was extremely rude and almost asked us to get lost, which completely upset us. We had no intimation from the hotel pre-booking that they keep the air-con shut ( we booked our room thru a third-party). There was no mention of the same on their website either. Unfortunately, the incident left us with a sour taste while leaving Venice. The manager of the hotel apologised for his staff's behavior while maintaining his stand that it was not the Hotel's fault; but, really, that guy shd have shown more maturity rather than just reacting like a child and resorting to lies. Would not recommend the Hotel, as its the people, and not just the room that contribute to your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “It exceeded our expectations....”
Reviews.Author: KitchenQueenCardiff
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Hotel Paganelli - and a brilliant week it was. We knew that the postion of the hotel was good as we had seen it on previous visits but the whole stay was a delight. We had a courtyard facing room that looked as though it had been recently refurbished - padded silk covered walls, neutral colours, high vaulted ceiling, lovely clean white bathroom. The room was VERY quiet, the breakfast was good for Italy! (they are not big on breakfasts). The reception staff were extremely helpful and helped us with alilaguna information and problems with our transfer back to the airport. It was so good - that we are planning our return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, FANTASTIC location!”
Reviews.Author: sistersuse
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location with the water stop being virtually infront of the main hotel and very close to main attractions like Palazzo Ducale and the Basilica only 3 minutes walk away!. I stayed in the single annexe room in a second building just down a little alley to the side of the main hotel. It was on ground floor level and from the outside looked like a shop window with frosted glass!! Although the police station was directly opposite my room and there was a bit of noise from passers by it didn't stop me from sleeping. Inside, the bedroom and bathroom were spotlessly clean and very comfortable and the breakfast room was just a couple of strides from my room. Breakfast was continental consisting of cereals, fruit, bread, cheese, ham, croissants etc. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at very reasonable rates!”
Reviews.Author: SarahD24
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this hotel. The price was great compared to other similar hotels in the same area and the location was very convenient for Saint Mark's Square and for travelling to any other part of the island. The Vaporetto (water bus) and water taxis are right outside the door. The water bus is very handy for getting around, dont be worried about getting tickets as there are ticket machines near the 'station' and you just validate it when you get one. Very handy. We had a room in the main hotel building overlooking the courtyard and we had a large balcony too. The service at the hotel could have been friendlier but that doesn't really matter to us. The breakfast is lovely and not a hassle at all walking just around the corner to the breakfast room. I would most certainly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Super super hotel in super super location!”
Reviews.Author: caroltong
Reviews.Content: Of all the years of travelling, Hotel Paganelli will be among one of my favourite hotels. Of course, please do not expect it to be the Ritz Carlton or Bangkok's Oriental Hotel because I only paid 90 GBP per room per night for a TRIPLE room located in the most expensive area in Venice. i.e St Marks Square. So for the money paid, this place far exceed expectations. First of all, the hotel's location is to die for. I am travelling with elderly parents who needed walking sticks and thus accessibility is my main concern. We were grinning with delight when we alighted from the vaparetto (waterbus) because the hotel was so near! I think if I throw a stone hard enough from the vaparetto stop, it will hit the hotel. There are different numbers for vaparettos running different routes. The stop just in front of the hotel caters to No. 2, 5, 41, 42, 52 and N. The more popular No. 1 vaparetto's stop is slightly away, but just another extra 1 minute walk (even for my parents) across a small bridge. St Marks Square is a three minutes walk from the hotel which made sightseeing so convenient. For other places, we just hopped onto the vaparettos. On top of that, the 24-hour hotel reception staff are really friendly and professional. We met 3 different guys during our stay and all of them are great! They know their guests' room numbers and we did not even once need to tell them our room number when we collect our keys. They are very helpful and will give you a free Venice map. Our triple room was clean and huge. The room is separated into two sections. The bathroom and wardrobe near the entrance; and the beds in another section further in. The room is not facing the Grand Canal though and I was aware of this when I booked the room. The staff even gave us the room nearest the lift so that my parents need not walk much. There was no problem with noise as the lift was near our bathroom and the beds were in another part of the room separated by a door. Bathroom is clean and the bathtub is larger then most hotels. Breakfast comes free and it is adequate though with bread and croissants, hard boiled eggs, some fruits, cereal and some cold cut meat. The waitress will then get your order for coffee or tea. Do not expect a cooked English breakfast or similar fare though. However, this is not a setback because I do not really rate hotels by their breakfast. To me, location, staff and cleanliness are more important factors. The most memorable experience of the stay is walking out of the hotel everyday and face to face with gondolas bobbling in the water . Overall, we are very pleased with our stay and I will definitely stay here again when I return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “great location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: rmco
Reviews.Content: i stayed for four nights in a single, standard annex room in January 2010. The annex is located about 25 metres from the main building. I had heard reviews that the annex rooms were noisy during summer if you had the windows open. As i was staying in winter, I was not concerned. I found the room to be terribly noisy and would not recommend staying there at any time. The room was also quite small with little room for an open suitcase. Definitely book into the main building for a great stay. You get off the water boat at San Zaccaria and the hotel is to your right 1 minute away. 2 minutes in the other direction will take you to St Marks. I cannot rate the hotel staff more highly. From suggestions for things to do and see, to finding transport times and a pharmacy that was open on a Sunday, I could ask for no more. I even got a hug when I was leaving!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: NorCalDadPaloAlto_CA
Reviews.Content: This is the best value in Venice. 2 minute walk to St Marks. Great breakfast. I stayed in the single in the annex, which is small, but hey for the price it cannot be beat. They are offering nights for that room in January for $75USD per night - almost unheard of for a hotel right on the Canal. The annex is very quiet, and it is where you get breakfast, so that makes things convenient. The guys at the front desk were pretty helpful as well. Free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Jo_Bill
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Christmas. The 2nd floor room with lagoon view was superb. Lovely and warm despite snow and ice outside. Bathroom very modern and efficient. The staff are really nice and so helpful. Due to various delays we arrived at 3am - the night porter led us to our room; he didn't take our luggage because it was still in Amsterdam. Reception chased them in the morning and it arrived that evening. Breakfast is in the annexe round the corner, but for a mere 4 euros reception will send to your room a tray of rolls, croissants, yoghurt etc which arrives in minutes. To have breakfast with one of the best views in Venice out of the French window is an absolute delight. Free internet access, but as another reviewer says, the network cable they lend you is a bit short (1 metre) so worth packing your own. The double glazing is excellent at keeping out the noise. There are many restaurants within easy staggering distance. Reception will advise and give you a map. A nice touch is that the room has a small empty fridge, rather than a rip-off mini-bar. We wish more hotels did that. The room was kept spotlessly clean. There is a lift (not invariable in Venice). We have stayed at a number of hotels in Venice up to 5*, and would rank our experience at the Paganelli as one of the best!

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt have asked for anything better!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisJRP
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 4 day stay at this great little hotel. We had Room 207 in the main hotel overlooking the lagoon. Amazing view. Get this room if you can! Although when the window was open there was a general noise of chatter and so forth from people below on the street, if it was shut you couldnt hear a thing which was great for sleeping at night. Staff very helpful. Breakfast was buffet, help yourself type, and there was always plenty to help yourself to no matter what time you appeared! Great location being 2 minutes slow stroll to St Marks Square and also easy location to go on Grand Canal tours or to visit any of the nearby islands. Go to Murano - great glass! If I go back to Venice, I would have no hesitation in booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere not recommended”
Reviews.Author: WendoGoldCoast_Qld
Reviews.Content: Apart from excellent location I think you could find better in Venice. We had insects crawling on walls and flying around room. The man on front desk gave me a can of insect spray!! The dead insects were not cleaned off the floor the next day and there were more in the room. We requested another room only to be told they were full. We insisted that we move rooms and after coming and checking our room they reluctantly agreed (they were not full). Exceptionally poor service and would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: rickyticky
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is ideal for a central location in Venice. It is only minutes from San Marco and right opposite the ferry point for the transfers to the airport. The staff were helpful and the breakfast was good. Our room was clean and comfortable although quite small. It was facing the inner courtyard and had a balcony with chairs. The roof terrace was a lovely place to seat after a day's sightseeing to soak in the fantastic waterfront views of Venice. There was a mini supermarket a few minutes away where you could buy wine or other refreshments to enjoy on the roof, the hotel will also provide you with ice upon request. One of the highlights of our stay was a water taxi for 2 on a circular route which took 45 minutes and included the Grand Canal, it was 90 Euros and worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay:Economical & quite comfortable”
Reviews.Author: NeeR_RG
Reviews.Content: Had a very good experience at this hotel.We had a inner view room on the 2nd floor. Positives: 1)The location is fantastic, breath taking view and 2 min walking distance from the main vaporetto stops 2) 5 mins from St.Marks square. 3) Extremely helpful staff, able to understand english very well. 4) Clean comfortable rooms 5) The location makes it easily reachable from all the main attractions giving you enough time to come and rest in between your day. 6) Quite and not too much hustle bustle inside the hotel. Negatives: 1) Rooms could have been a little bigger 2)The b'fast location is in another building, but its quite close so not a major problem 3) The lady incharge of the breakfast room was particularly rude.

Reviews.Title: “amazing location, but older hotel”
Reviews.Author: stephhatchman
Reviews.Content: the location of this hotel is perfect but it needs some updating. i was in the older annex section of the hotel which is around the corner from the main hotel and reception which made things a little quieter in the evenings but it was a pain to have to go to the front desk to get the key everytime i returned to the hotel. (i think this is normal for hotels in venice as a couple other people i met from different hotels had to turn in their keys everytime they left their rooms). the room was decent but it was quite old and in need of some updating. breakfast was served in the lobby of the annex and it was included in the price of the room and in room WiFi was included as well. i spent a lot of time looking for a budget hotel in venice and i think simply for the location i would recommend this one but maybe try for a room in the main building, not the annex.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Great Character”
Reviews.Author: gschirm
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its fantastic location and phenomenal air conditioning! You are a 1 minute walk from San Marco and the main hub of everything Venice. Venice was also extremely hot when we visited so each afternoon we would slip back to the room for a break from the heat and the air conditioning was a savior! The rooms are a very small but very nice with so much character. I loved the exposed wooden beams and hard wood floors. It was actually very romantic in the city of romance which was perfect for us since we were on Honeymoon. The rooms were also incredibly clean which was so refreshing after walking around in the heat all day. The bed was huge and comfortable as well. Another positive was the breakfast. You can get fresh cappuccino, bowl of fruit, musli, meat, yogurt, cheese etc... It was very good and a great way to start the day. Overall for the price this place is a fantastic find in Venice and I highly recommend it for all the reasons listed above. I really can't think of anything bad to say about it at all!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - perfect location, lovely room and decent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ringmac
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent value hotel for a very expensive city - 150 Euros a night incl breakfast. The location could not be better, if you are arriving by train, the vaporetto (public water boat transport) is right outside the station and drops your right outside the hotel on stop "San Zaccaria" - you see the hotel before the stop. Our room was in the main building and newly decorated with large marble bathroom (great shower) small bedroom but that is not uncommon in Italy with flat screen TV, air con, safe and fridge - couldn't be better. Breakfast was served in their annex building - breakfast good but I would think the rooms in the old building were a little dated, asked for a room in the new building. Our room was very quiet and we overlooked the internal courtyard. No complaints at all!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: pgfibro
Reviews.Content: If you are arriving in Venice from the airport by vaporetto, Hotel Paganelli is ideally located right at the San Zaccaria landing. It is also in a great spot from which to explore Venice. On arrival we received a complimentary upgrade to a superior room. Room 101 was very modern, very clean, and very quiet. It is also serviced by an elevator, so no lugging suitcases up stairs. The continental breakfast was very nice, as was the lady who served it. All the hotel staff that we met were most pleasant, and very helpful. All in all, a top little place.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - recommended”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen37
Reviews.Content: I'd booked a single, at a very good rate, and was staying in the annex. I was grateful to find my room had been upgraded to a double, and although compact, which isn't a problem as I wasn't in the room much, it was exceptionally clean. Staff very pleasant and helpful, breakfast good and an excellent, central location, especially if like me, you arrived late in the evening. The hotel is just directly in front of the San Zaccaria Alilaguna stop, so ideal. I'd stay here again, though next time, may pay extra for one of the lagoon view rooms!

Reviews.Title: “AMazing little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SamMAberdeen
Reviews.Content: We booked four nights from the 30th of December through Expedia and basically chose it on the strength of it's location. It's so handy for everywhere, I can't recommend it enough. I actually contacted the hotel directly to upgrade our room as a surprise for my girlfriend and they couldn't have been more helpful also. We got the water bus, it was just over an hour from Marco Polo airport. How good to be able to get off at the landing stop in front of the hotel and walk twenty meters to get to the hotel! Breakfast was fine enough, a selection of cold meats, rolls, fruit, juice and coffee. It's in the older part of the hotel which is a twenty second walk down an alleyway. We had a deluxe room with lagoon view and it was amazing. We even had a little balcony that opened out onto the lagoon giving us fantastic views at all hours of the day. Someone comes in to change bedsheets and towels every day and he couldn't have been more helpful. There are no ironing facilities although they will do it for you at housekeeping. There is a small charge per item, just a couple of euros though. The room also had a safe and ample storage facilities. There are two English speaking news channels too so that's a help. Pretty much everyone understood English in Venice which was good. We did try out our Italian and managed to scrape by but it's reassuring to know that a lot of locals speak English. I'd definitely stay at the Paganelli again if I get back to Venice. It's such a fabulous hotel in such a great city. Please go, you won't regret it...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Rips2
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel, right on the waterfront and only 2 minutes walk from San Marco. The staff are really helpful and friendly. Our room was beautifully decorated with silk lined walls and matching bedding. Breakfast was plentiful, ham cheese & boiled eggs with hot bread rolls. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: k8lib
Reviews.Content: What a great location! Right near the Vaporetto stop (incl. the Alilaguna from the Airport!). Near enough to stroll to most of Venice`s major attractions, but far enough away that you could see a bit of `real` Venice! This hotel has two wings, old and new, and we ended up staying in both as we had to book an extra night unexpectedly. First, the old. We checked in at night, so couldn`t tell you what its like during the day. Our room was a lovely old ornate room with beautiful furnishings. Relatively quiet (except for many Venetians heading to work from the Vaporetto stop after 7:30 am) and clean and comfortable. The bathroom was small but satisfactory. Now, the new. The porter moved our luggage from our old room to our new room while we were out sightseeing, so we didn`t need to worry about that. It had a small balcony that overlooked the courtyard of the hotel, so was quite quiet. On our last night there we did have a guest staying above us who we could hear moving about because they were wearing big heavy shoes, but apart from that, we slept well. The breakfasts were delicious and really set us up for a day`s sightseeing! The staff were helpful and amusing. This new part of the hotel is just being finished as I write this, and promises to be very nice indeed. They had two English language TV channels (BBC world and CNN) so we were able to keep up with the news! You can also book rooms looking out over the Canal toward San Giorgio, which would have a great view!

Reviews.Title: “Wow to the renovations!”
Reviews.Author: hula1girl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed many many times at Hotel Paganelli and as a travel agent and guide, I have also booked many clients into this hotel over the years. What a wonderful surprise when I arrived in May 2008. They had just gone through an entire renovation. New elevator, new lobby, new rooms, new bathrooms! We loved it. What didn't change was the wonderful welcome and service we have always received and the pleasant breakfast. I for one plan on returning each year as long as I am able to travel.

Reviews.Title: “location, location,location”
Reviews.Author: atabh
Reviews.Content: Located just 2 minuutes walking distance from st. marks square hotel is ideally located to explore venice. rates are reasonable. breakfast is decent. Getting here from the train station is easy, catch ferry 42/52 and it stops right in front of the hotel ( next stop after st. marks square) receptionist was very friedly and spoke fluent english, helped us with maps and show bookings. rooms have a nice venetian decor and are of good size. no elevators in the old wing so if you are on the second floor with lugage it might be a bit difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: TCHendo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights in Hotel Paganelli as the beginning of our honeymoon. As the front hotel was being renovated we were placed in the second hotel around the corner and are now quite thankful for this (it was much quieter). It was a lovely room, quite large with very pretty furniture. The location was just perfect. A quick walk down the alley to the Grand Canal and two minutes from the main centre attractions. The breakfasts were good, typical European fare, but nicely laid out and my husband says they made the best coffee of our entire trip (he tends to rate places by the coffee alone!) I'd recommend our room to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at the Hotel Paganelli!”
Reviews.Author: peppergirlVancouver
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel in a great location - close to the San Zaccaria vaporetto stop and very close to Piazza San Marco and other sights as well as restaurants. The room and bath were small (but that is the norm in Italy, it seems) but very clean with antique furnishings. The breakfasts were very good, contintental style with meats, cheeses, hard boiled eggs, pastries etc. The coffee was wonderful - you could order whatever you wanted and they prepared it for you - lattes, cappucino etc. The front desk service was great. You have to turn in your key whenever you leave the hotel however the staff remembered my room number each time I returned to the hotel and handed me my key without asking for my room number. There is free internet in the lobby which was handy. Please note there is no elevator at this hotel. Altogether a great experience and I will stay here again if I am lucky enough to come back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A dump in a great location”
Reviews.Author: FrontRangeTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Paganelli is a dump. dump with a great location, but still, this is a dump. Noisy, small, not too clean with the 2nd worse breakfast of all our hotels. Just say "no". There must be many better choices. One kind word for Marco on the front desk. Truly helpful, pleasant and gracious.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DublinMember1616
Reviews.Content: I would highly recomend this hotel for a short trip to Venice. We stayed there for 3 nights in April and had no problems at all. The location is perfect with San Marco only a short walk away. Restaurants are all close by and the hotel is right by the water. Great base for a great city. I dont know why its only ranked 196 at the time I write this!!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Paganelli
HotelInfo.Address: Castello 4182 | Riva degli Schiavoni, 30122 Venice, Italy
